2.comment: Hines Ward (4 catches, 34 yards) and Santonio Holmes (3 catches, 32 yards) disappointed fantasy owners.

3.comment: Hines Ward blindsided Keith Rivers in the first quarter, dishing out a nasty (but clean) block.

4.comment: Hines Ward (30 yards), Heath Miller (52) and Limas Sweed (28) all matched that figure.

6.comment: Hines Ward (5 catches, 37 yards, TD) and Heath Miller (4 catches, 60 yards).

7.comment: Hines Ward caught just 1 pass for 2 yards.

8.comment: Hines Ward (7 catches, 109 yards) and Santonio Holmes (5 catches, 93 yards) were the recipients of Roethlisberger's scores.

9.comment: Hines Ward paced Pittsburgh with 6 receptions and 70 yards.

10.comment: Hines Ward 6 times (57 yards). Holmes had a key touchdown drop on Pittsburgh's final drive.    The Steelers once again couldn't run the ball.

11.comment: Hines Ward (4 catches, 82 yards) and slot receiver Mike Wallace (7-102) did all of the work.

12.comment: Hines Ward (7 catches, 85 yards), Heath Miller (5-54) and Mike Wallace (2-52).

13.comment: Hines Ward touchdown, but ruled the catch incomplete even though the ball never hit the ground. When that happened, I had a pretty good feeling that the Steelers weren't going to cover the spread.    Two big stories for the Steelers. On the defensive side, Troy Polamalu played just his second game of the season. Polamalu made his presence known with an interception. Polamalu limped off the field on the same left knee he hurt in the opener after making the pick, but he returned to the game later on.    On offense, Ben Roethlisberger was 23-of-35 for a whopping 417 yards, 2 touchdowns and a pick. Roethlisberger was sacked 3 times, but often had a ton of time to throw on most plays. On his first score, Roethlisberger seriously had 10 seconds in the pocket.    Hines Ward and Santonio Holmes both had huge games.

14.comment: Hines Ward did nothing in this contest, catching just 1 ball for 3 yards.

15.comment: Hines Ward, who had just 4 grabs for 24 yards.

16.comment: Hines Ward, who had just 4 grabs for 24 yards.

17.comment: Hines Ward (10 catches, 128 yards, TD), Heath Miller (7-95, TD) and Santonio Holmes (7-86).

19.comment: Hines Ward, Heath Miller and Santonio Holmes.

20.comment: Hines Ward, hobbled with an injured hamstring, had 4 grabs for 37 yards.

21.comment: Hines Ward didn't get into the end zone, but played well despite his hamstring, collecting 8 receptions for 61 yards.    The Steelers rushed for 202 yards in this contest, with

22.comment: Hines Ward, who had 6 catches for 108 yards.

23.comment: Hines Ward had 1 reception for 9 yards.

24.comment: Hines Ward scored Batch's other touchdown, finishing with 3 grabs for 34 yards.

25.comment: Hines Ward (14) and Rashard Mendenhall (9) all had 2.

26.comment: Hines Ward (5-54, TD) and Heath Miller (2-50, TD) were all thrilled to have their starting quarterback in the lineup again.

28.comment: Hines Ward (2-39) couldn't do much as Roethlisberger was constantly under siege.

29.comment: Hines Ward was sidelined with a concussion after a first-quarter helmet-to-helmet hit that will likely draw a fine.

30.comment: Hines Ward was sidelined with a concussion after a first-quarter helmet-to-helmet hit that will likely draw a fine.

32.comment: Hines Ward (8-115) and Mike Wallace (5-78) took advantage of Cincinnati's skeleton-crew secondary, but Rashard Mendenhall (18-66) surprisingly struggled against Cincinnati's defense.

33.comment: Hines Ward away (2-34) with Darrelle Revis, so Big Ben threw exclusively to Mike Wallace (7-102) and rookie Emmanuel Sanders (7-78).

35.comment: Hines Ward on TV this spring. Mendenhall gained just 37 yards on 18 carries.    As shocking as it was to see Pittsburgh struggle to run the football, it was even more surprising to watch Indianapolis have so much success on the ground.

36.comment: Hines Ward. After a Titans punt, the Steelers had the ball at their own 9.yard line. Backup running back

37.comment: Hines Ward (5-24) wasn't impressive statistically, but his fifth reception was the 1,000th of his career.
